{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the patient's history and physical examination findings, she most likely has De Quervain tenosynovitis, which is inflammation of the tendons in the first dorsal compartment of the wrist. The characteristic findings include pain and swelling over the radial aspect of the wrist, limited range of motion, and tenderness to palpation over the anatomical snuffbox. X-rays are typically normal in De Quervain tenosynovitis. The initial management for De Quervain tenosynovitis is conservative treatment, which includes rest, ice, and immobilization with a thumb spica splint. Corticosteroid injections may be considered if conservative treatment fails. Percutaneous pinning is not indicated for De Quervain tenosynovitis.", "answer_choice": "C"}
